comments:
This only happens with a fresh workspace using the 

M-1.5.2-200610131205 build
To create:

1)Start new workspace
2) Create a Dynamic Web Project
3) Add a new servlet using the add Servlet Wizard
4) enter servlet parameters
5) Click finish


Servlet creation will fail and you will get the follwing stack trace:

The problem also repeats for all subclasses of ArtifactEditProviderOperation  not specific to Servlet operation.  

I was building a wizard for the eclipsecon tutorial  that uses an ArtifactEditProviderOperation and I get this exception too when I test it with a fresh workspace, fresh project, etc.  but it does not repeat if the workspace is restarted.

Could this be an initialization issue somewhere in the guts of artifactEdit creation?  The problem is due to initialize method of the operation failing create an artifactEdit for write from a virtual component.  It fails to create it because it claims the state of the module Web is not consistent. 


----

Naci - I just downloaded

wtp-sdk-M-1.5.2-200610181217

and I can't reproduce your behavior....   We haven't dropped anything in the last day, so I'm a bit baffled....

Ok - I can see apotential problem that was interoduced months ago when we worked on refactoring jem dependencies....  We missed an extension point that registers a validateEdit handler in headless mode.

You must be getting into a state that doesn't start the j2ee.ui bundle.

I'll attach a patch that ads this ext point to the org.eclipse.jst.common.frameworks plugin

<extension 
       point="org.eclipse.jem.util.uiContextSensitiveClass">
       <uiContextSensitiveClass
          key="ValidateEditContext"
          className="org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emfworkbench.validateedit.ValidateEditHeadlessContext"
          context="Headless"/>
  </extension>

Naci - I think this should be fixed eventually, 
but I'm not sure if its blocking because I can't reproduce.
(I can't figure out why the j2eeui plugin isn't being started when creating a web project)

Do you have headless ant tasks, or commands that are setting this up?  like a junit?

Chuck,

I will download the new SDK and try it again.  I will reduce the severity if it does not repeat the problem.

I too could not reproduce, using wtp-sdk-M-1.5.2-200610172155.zip 
so ... if you can reproduce Naci ... be sure to give very exact steps.

I could not repeat the problem with wtp-sdk-M-1.5.2-200610181217 - so reduce the severity.  I am not sure if it was my workspace that was in a quirky state last night.  

I will try to work on it more while writing the tutorial see if I can find what exactly caused it, if not close the bug in a few weeks.

I am not clear if the patch is needed...
I'm removing 152 target, since severity reduced, and Naci will be investigating.

This happens when you are starting eclipse with the JDK 1.4 but telling eclipse to use JDK 1.5 in the window.preferences settings.

Starting your eclipse like this fixes the problem:

C:\eclipse3.2.1\eclipse.exe -vm "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\javaw.exe"

Presuming of course you are using eclipse from the directory shown above, and you have the JVM installed in the location shown here.  But you should get the idea from the above command line.

Can't reproduce....    The last comment (https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=161296#c8)

Is due to MANIFEST runtime restrictions for Java 5
